Package gameLogic

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameLogic.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    A board which has pieces stored in a 2D space of discrete squares. Pieces may be added, removed, and moved.
    Author:
    Alexander

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Board()
      Creates a new board of standard international 8x8 size.
      Board​(int width, int height)
      Creates a new board of specified dimensions.

      Determines whether a given space is black or white, given where it is.

        Creates a new board of specified dimensions.

        height - Height for numbered side.

        public Piece getPiece​(Touple t)
        Gets a piece based on its location on the board.
        Parameters:
        t - the location of the piece as a Touple.
        Returns:
        the piece at the specified location.

        Parameters:
        t - The location in question, as a Touple.
        Returns:
        True if the space is

      • randomEmptySpace

        public Touple randomEmptySpace()
        Gets a random space that has nothing in it.
        Returns:
        The space as a Touple.

      • locatePiece

        public Touple locatePiece​(Piece p)
        Gives the location of a piece on the board as known by the board, given any piece that is on the board.
        Parameters:
        p - The pieces to be located.
        Returns:
        A Touple that contains the location of that piece. If piece cannot be found, return null.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Gets the width of the board, in squares.
        Returns:
        The width as an int, of the board, in squares.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Gets the height of the board, in squares.
        Returns:
        The height as an int, of the board, in squares.

      • getSpaceColor

        public static java.lang.String getSpaceColor​(int x,
                                             int y)
        Determines whether a given space is black or white, given where it is.
        Parameters:
        x - 0-indexed x-coordinate of the space.
        y - 0-indexed y-coordinate of the space.
        Returns:
        "White" if it is white, "Black" if it is black.

      • getSpaceColor

        public static java.lang.String getSpaceColor​(Touple t)
        Determines whether a given space is black or white, given where it is.
        Parameters:
        t - The touple of the space specified.
        Returns:
        The color of the piece at the space (lowercase is standard).

      • isValidSquare

        public boolean isValidSquare​(Touple newPos)
        Determines if a given Touple is a valid space within the board.
        Parameters:
        newPos - The space to be checked.
        Returns:
        True if the space is a valid space, false if it is not (even if not empty).
